casebody.data:
Gurvinder SINGH, Petitioner v. Loretta LYNCH, U.S. Attorney General, Respondent. No. 14-60715

Summary Calendar.

United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. May 20, 2015. Gurvinder Singh, Tacoma, WA, pro se. *341Scott Michael Marconda, Esq., Tangerlia Cox, U.S. Department of Justice Office of Immigration Litigation, Washington, DC, for Respondent. Before SMITH, PRADO, and OWEN, Circuit Judges. PER CURIAM: *

Gurvinder Singh petitions for review of the Board of Immigration Appeals’s (BIA) order denying his motion to reconsider. Singh contends that the BIA failed to construe his motion to reconsider as a motion to reopen based on ineffective assistance of counsel and erred in concluding that his motion was untimely and number-barred. The respondent moves for summary disposition of the petition for review in lieu of filing a brief.

The BIA construed Singh’s motion as, in part, a motion to reopen. An alien may file only one motion to reopen. 8 U.S.C. § 1229a(c)(7)(A); 8 C.F.R. § 1003.2(c)(2). The motion at issue is Singh’s third motion to reopen. The exception to the numerical restriction for a motion to reopen an order entered in absentia or in removal proceedings is not applicable to his motion to reopen. See §§ 1003.2(c)(3); § 1003.23(b)(4)(ii). Thus, the BIA did not abuse its discretion in denying the motion as number-barred. See Zhao v. Gonzales, 404 F.3d 295, 303 (5th Cir.2005).

Singh’s petition for review is DENIED. The respondent’s motion for summary disposition of the petition for review in lieu of filing a brief is GRANTED.

Pursuant to 5th Cir. R. 47.5, the court has determined that this opinion should not be published and is not precedent except under the limited circumstances set forth in 5th Cir. R. 47.5.4.
